intro: Nonea toletana, commonly known as the Toletan heath, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in early spring. It thrives in rocky or sandy habitats and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
